page.title: 01BIGGLESWADE, BEDS.
page.content: Biggleswade is a market town of some 12,000 inhabitants, situated in the east of the county 45 miles north of London & 23 miles west of Cambridge. The name derives from 'waed', a ford, & the personal name 'Bicca', i.e.{ {Bicca's Ford.}Bounded on the west by the river Ivel, Biggleswade was formerly an important coaching stop on the old A1 main road, & indeed the town's development has been dominated by major changes in transport. The advent of the {Great Northern Railway} in 1850 brought prosperity, as produce & vegetables could be sent daily to London for sale. In the 1960s a bypass was built, heavy through traffic was diverted, & the town is now relatively peaceful. However Biggleswade is designated the main future growth area in E.Beds. & a substanial building programme has alresdy begun.
